snippet: The Trabant, the flyweight car produced by East Germany, remains a beloved artifact in Germany.
abstract: Trabant, flyweight car produced in Cold War Era East Germany, is seen by some as symbol of collapse of Eastern bloc and as beloved artifact by others; cars, banned at other times, are allowed on streets of Berlin on November 9 anniversary of fall of Berlin Wall.
lead_paragraph: The Trabant, the flyweight car produced by East Germany, remains a beloved artifact in Germany.

headline.main: Berlin Welcomes Back the Trabant, if Only for a Day
headline.print_headline: Berlin Welcomes Back the Trabant, if Only for a Day
